intro: Bubbia odorata, commonly known as the fragrant sandmat, is a perennial flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy, succulent stems. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. Bubbia odorata is adapted to harsh environments, with deep root systems that help it survive in dry conditions. Its aromatic foliage and resilience make it an interesting subject for botanical study and ecological research.
